item.title: Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion DLC ‘Into the Abyss’ now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

New bosses, a new map area, and new equipment.

Dark science-fiction action game Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion downloadable content expansion “Into the Abyss” is now available for $14.99, publisher Marvelous and developer First Studio announced. It is also available as part of the Digital Deluxe or Super Digital Deluxe editions of the game.

Here is an overview of the content, via Marvelous:

“Into the Abyss” takes Outers to the brand-new Survey Zone: Locus Initi, where exciting story quests, challenging enemies, and powerful new gear await. A free update releasing at the same time as the expansion includes additional bug fixes and improvements to the game, and players can expand their customization and communication options with new paid downloadable content.

Survey Zone: Locus Initi is home to the Genesis Tree, a massive Femtree that could be seen from other areas in the game but was previously inaccessible. In a new storyline taking place outside of the main narrative, the Reclaimer Blossom tasks players with investigating an alien landscape teeming with Femto-enhanced enemies. Beyond battling the dangerous fauna that call Locus Initi home, players can take on an Axiom base hidden within the Genesis Tree and earn rewards including powerful new gear.

This release also introduces two new sets of cosmetic downloadable content:

  • Stamp Set (communication stamps based on the Reclaimers and Sovereign Axiom) – $3.99
  • Avatar Customization Pack 5 (four face accessories) – $2.49

These new items join downloadable content recently released on October 29:

  • Sovereign Axiom Outfit Set* (10 outfits) – $11.99
  • Grand Entrance Set 1 (five entrances) – $4.99
  • Grand Entrance Set 2 (four entrances) – $4.99
  • Vehicle Set (three vehicles) – $6.99
  • Decal Set (23 decals) – $3.99

*Included in the Digital Deluxe and Super Digital Deluxe Editions

Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam on September 5 worldwide.

item.title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond ‘Overview’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• Switch
  • Switch 2

A seven-minute overview.

Publisher Nintendo and developer Retro Studios have released a seven-minute overview trailer for first-person shooter sequel Metroid Prime 4: Beyond.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nintendo:

About

After an unexpected accident, Samus finds herself transported to the mysterious planet Viewros. Scan your surroundings for clues, make the most of your equipment and weapons, and use Samus’s newfound psychic abilities—and her technologically advanced bike, the Vi-O-La—to traverse and explore the environment. You’ll need every tool at your disposal to survive and escape Viewros.

Bounty Hunter: Samus Aran

One of the greatest bounty hunters in the galaxy. Capable of completing any mission—no matter the danger.

World: Planet Viewros

An unknown planet. Samus suddenly finds herself transported to the greenery of an ancient jungle.

Objective: Explore the Mysterious Planet to Find a Way Home

Scan stone statues and ruins for clues on how to move forward. Battle abhorrant alien creatures who inhabit the planet.

Powers: Psychic Abilities

Mysterious powers that Samus acquires while exploring the planet. Wield them wisely to clear your path forward.

Friend or Foe? Lamorn

An alien race that once existed on planet Viewros. They make a solemn request of Samus.

Deadly Sharpshooter: Sylux

An enigmatic bounty hunter with a deep-seated grudge against the Galactic Federation—and Samus.

Switch 2 Enhancements

  • Aim With Joy-Con 2 Mouse Controls – Play using mouse controls made possible by the Joy-Con™ 2 controllers or standard button controls. Move the right Joy-Con 2 controller like a mouse to aim and navigate with greater precision.
  • Choose Your Display Mode – Explore planet Viewros in greater detail with a higher resolution, faster framerate, and HDR support for more vivid colors. Go all-in on visual detail with Quality Mode, or choose Performance Mode to prioritize even smoother gameplay. You can choose either mode to suit your preference.
    • Quality Mode
      • Docked – 4K resolution / 60 frames per second / HDR
      • Handheld / Tabletop – 1080p resolution / 60 frames per second / HDR
    • Performance Mode
      • Docked – 1080p resolution / 120 frames per second / HDR
      • Handheld / Tabletop – 720p resolution / 120 frames per second / HDR

Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is due out for Switch 2 and Switch on December 4.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero version 2.4 update ‘On the Precipice of the Abyss’ launches November 26
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Smartphone
  • Xbox Series

Dialyn and Banyue join the fray.

The version 2.4 update for Zenless Zone Zero, dubbed “On the Precipice of the Abyss,” will launch on November 26, developer miHoYo announced.

Here is an overview of the update, via miHoYo:

Following the Timesworn Hill crisis, an intertwined adventure unfolds in the old mining site as the Miasma begins to recede from the depths of the Lemnian Hollow in this new update. The arrival of agents Dialyn and Banyue from the Krampus Compliance Authority introduces not only new allies to the battlefield, but perhaps new judgment agendas as well.

With the assistance of the Krampus Compliance Authority—a TOPS-affiliated enforcement organization tasked with disciplinary oversight—the Proxies successfully averted a disaster beneath Timesworn Hill and glimpsed deeper mysteries waiting within Yidhari’s dreamscape. Fleeting visions revealed the figures of Sarah and Ye Shiyuan together—an unexpected sight, given that the senior member of Yunkui Summit is not thought to be involved in the conspiracy of the Exaltists and their Creator. Meanwhile, his younger sister, Ye Shunguang, now ascended as the new master of the Qingming Sword, joins the Proxies to embark on a journey to uncover the truth. As the Miasma recedes, the old mining site buried a decade ago resurfaces, hinting at new dangers and unseen forces stirring once more.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Amid the shifting order and chaos, two agents join the fray. Dialyn, an S-Rank Physical Stun Agent from Krampus brings her experience as a cheeky customer service specialist to the battlefield. Using two unique resources, Customer Complaint and Positive Review, she excels at stunning enemies while calling up teammates to directly unleash their Ultimate abilities in combat, amplifying the team’s damage. Banyue, an S-Rank Fire Rupture agent and a revered martial arts master, has fused countless techniques into a combination style of immense power and splendor. His combat technique relies on alternating Adrenaline and Wrathful Fires to sustain his continuous actions and fluid combos, rewarding players who master his rhythm.

Two new Bangboo companions also join the battlefield in Version 2.4. Birkblick from Krampus features a multifunctional sensor array that transforms into a floating cannon during combat, scanning and bombarding targets with energy blasts. Meanwhile, the cheerful Bild N. Boolok wields a massive block hammer to smash enemies.

Beyond these new arrivals, Version 2.4 also welcomes back Agents Hugo (Attack – Ice) and Ellen (Attack – Ice). The beloved Bangboo auto chess event also returns with new upgrades—now featuring PvE special stages and offering exclusive rewards, including a free Bild N. Boolok. Meanwhile, the event Lightstream Notes invites players to enjoy New Eridu alongside Ye Shunguang, discovering fleeting moments of lightheartedness amid the deepening shadows.

Zenless Zone Zero is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PC via client download and Epic Games Store, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play.

item.title: Wuthering Waves version 2.8 update ‘To the City Set in Amber’ launches November 20
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Smartphone

Chisa and Buling join the fray.

Kuro Games will release the version 2.8 update for free-to-play open-world action RPG Wuthering Waves, dubbed “To the City Set in Amber,” on November 20, the developer announced.

Here is an overview of the update:

  • New Main Quests
    • Chapter II Act XII: Stagnant Dawn on Wastelands
    • Chapter II Segue: Flowing Starlight in the Iris
  • New Outfits
    • Downtown Repose: Zani – Deluxe Outfit
  • New Location
    • Chronorift Metropolis
  • New Echoes
    • Nightmare: Baby Roseshroom
    • Nightmare: Tick Tack
    • Nightmare: Dwarf Cassowary
  • New Phantom Echo
    • Phantom: The False Sovereign
  • New Sonata Effect
    • Thread of Severed Fate – 3pcs Set: Inflicting Havoc Bane increases the Resonator’s ATK by 20% and grants 30% Resonance Liberation DMG Bonus for 5s.
  • New Tactical Hologram Challenge
    • Tactical Hologram: The False Sovereign
  • Updated Negative Statuses
    • Havoc Bane – Some Havoc attacks will apply a stackable Havoc Bane effect to the target. While Havoc Bane lasts, the DEF of the inflicted target is reduced. Havoc Bane stacks up to 3 times by default, with each stack reducing the target’s DEF by 2%.
    • Fusion Burst – Some Fusion attacks will apply a stackable Fusion Burst effect to the target. When Fusion Burst is stacked to its max, all stacks will be removed to trigger an explosion, dealing Fusion DMG around the target. Fusion Burst effect stacks up to 10 times by default. The higher the stacks, the more DMG dealt.
    • Glacio Chafe – Some Glacio attacks will apply a stackable Glacio Chafe effect to the target. When Glacio Chafe is inflicted, the target receives Glacio DMG. Glacio Chafe stacks up to 10 times by default. The higher the stacks, the more DMG dealt. Each stack of Glacio Chafe effect reduces the target’s Movement Speed. When Glacio Chafe reaches max stacks, the target will be frozen, and all stacks of Glacio Chafe will be removed. Struggle to accelerate your recovery from the frozen state.
    • Electro Flare – Some Electro attacks will apply a stackable Electro Flare effect to the target. While Electro Flare lasts, it deals periodic Electro DMG to the target. The target loses half of the effect stacks with each instance of damage. Electro Flare stacks up to 10 times by default. The higher the stacks, the more DMG dealt. At maximum stacks of Electro Flare, any new stack inflicted becomes stackable Electro Rage. Electro Rage increases the DMG dealt by the next Electro Flare trigger. Electro Rage is removed once triggered. Electro Rage stacks up to 10 times by default. The higher the stacks, the more DMG Electro Flare deals.
  • Optimizations
    • Performance Optimizations – Following the Version 2.8 update, the GPU load from Ray Tracing under the same graphics settings will be effectively reduced, boosting the game’s performance efficiency while running with this option enabled.
      The Global Illumination effects will be optimized in certain scenes to provide even more immersive lighting in certain areas. Support for DFAO (Distance Field Ambient Occlusion) will be added under some PC graphics settings to bring in richer and more natural lighting.
    • Echo Absorption – Following the Version 2.8 update, one-click absorption of all absorbable Echoes in a specific radius will be added. A “Main Echo” slot will be added to the “Suggest” feature on the Echo equipment menu.
    • Upgrade Materials Management – An “Auto Supplement” feature will be added to the Resonator Ascension, Weapon Ascension, and Skill Upgrade menus. When the required upgrade materials are insufficient, clicking this button will open the Auto Supplement screen, where you can directly see which materials you need and use Synthesis, Conversion, or Supply Packs. During Synthesis, if low-rarity materials are insufficient, the system will begin searching for lower-rarity materials and Supply Packs to auto-fill the required material list until all requirements are met.
    • Better Combat Experience – The Guidebook tabs will be reorganized. You can use the tabs to quickly jump to Recurring Challenges or material farming spots. More details will be displayed for Recurring Challenges, including remaining time and challenge progress, making them easier to track and navigate. When a “Tactical Hologram: Phantom Pain challenge” is initiated again, the Resonators will enter it with full STA. Additionally, the Boss Challenges experience will be optimized; in the prompt that appears after exiting or completing a challenge, the original “Cancel” button will now be replaced with a “Restart” button.
    • Auto Mute – A “Mute when Game is in the Background” option will be added on PC with Windows. When the option is enabled, the game will be muted automatically if minimized to the taskbar or running in the background.
  • New Resonators
    • Chisa (5-Star)
    • Buling (4-Star)
  • Upcoming Featured Resonator Convene
    • Phase I
      • Horizon of Dawnbreak
      • With Hushed Whispers..
    • Phase II
      • Requiem Without End
      • Neptune’s Library
  • New Weapon
    • Kumokiri (5-Star)
  • Upcoming Featured Weapon Convene
    • Phase I
      • Kumokiri
      • Luminous Hymn
    • Phase II
      • Lethean Elegy
      • Whispers of Sirens
  • Special Events
    • Stranger Things in Honami – Combat Event
    • Gifts of Amber – 7-Day Login Event
    • Tactical Simulacra: Off Tune – Featured Combat Event
    • Whispers of the Waves – Photo Collection Event
    • Lollo Campaign: Rising Anew – Featured Commission Event
    • Search for It! Bits of Lahai-Roi – Showcase Event

Wuthering Waves is available now for PlayStation 5, PC via client download and Epic Games Store, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play. The PC version will also be available via Steam starting April 29.
